intro: Gouania paniculata, commonly known as the panicled gouania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces showy, yellowish-white flowers arranged in panicles, which are branched inflorescences. Gouania paniculata is often found in moist, tropical habitats and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
